titles: The merry bell-man's out-cryes, or, The city's O yes being a mad merry ditty both pleasant and witty, to be cry'd in prick-song prose through country and city ... / not by L.P. but J.C.
author: J. C.
L. P., 17th cent.
publisher: Printed in the year of Bartledum Fair, 1655, when few honest men can thrive,
notes: Imperfect: print show-through, with loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
